info.description: Welcome to the Swagger documentation page for Audience Manager Customer Data API. For a complete description of the feature, see [Audience Manager Customer Data API Overview](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/customer-api-overview.html)
info.title: Audience Manager Customer Data API

tags.name: stream
tags.description: Data streaming. Allows multiple profile updates on the same call. Find out more in the [Making API Calls](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/making-api-calls.html#post-stream-call) documentation page.

tags.name: profile viewer
tags.description: Get trait and segment qualification information for a profile from all Audience Manager regions. Use this endpoint to validate successful data onboarding.

tags.name: data collection
tags.description: Data streaming using the Audience Manager Data Collection API.

externalDocs.description: More information about the DCS API:

post.summary: Ingest profile updates related to a given data stream.
post.description: The maximum request size is limited to 100K.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key configured for your application. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

application/json.description: Profile updates to be ingested via the specified data stream.

200.description:
A 200 OK status code means all profile updates have been successfully processed.
200 OK along with a `UpdateUsersDataResponse` with status:`PARTIAL_SUCCESS` implies some of the profile updates could not be successfully processed due to internal errors. Those profile updates are described in the error details object.

get.summary: Get trait and segment qualification information for a profile from all Audience Manager regions.
get.description: Returns aggregated information for a profile, including trait and segment qualification information. You can filter the requests by region to return qualification information from certain regions only.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key configured for your application. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

parameters.name: filter[regionId]
parameters.description: One or more [location Ids](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-regions.html), separated by comma, that correspond to the region(s) where profile information should be fetched from.

200.description: OK. Returns the aggregated profile information including trait and segment qualification.

404.description: Not found. Some resource could not be found.

get.summary: Ingest a single Audience Manager profile update via a GET call.
get.description:
This API is built on top of the [Data Collection Audience Manager API](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-keys.html).
A Data Collection API call translates to a single profile update. Use the Stream API if you need to ingest multiple profile updates in the same call.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key configured for your application. See: https://www.adobe.io/authentication/auth-methods.html#!AdobeDocs/adobeio-auth/master/AuthenticationOverview/APIKeyIntegration.md

post.summary: Ingest a single Audience Manager profile update via a POST call.
post.description:
This API is built on top of the [Data Collection Audience Manager API](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-keys.html).
A Data Collection API call translates to a single profile update. Use the Stream API if you need to ingest multiple profile updates in the same call.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key configured for your application. See: https://www.adobe.io/authentication/auth-methods.html#!AdobeDocs/adobeio-auth/master/AuthenticationOverview/APIKeyIntegration.md

streamId.name: streamId
streamId.description:
You must add a `streamID` to each Customer API call. The `streamID` is an alphanumeric identifier, and must match the string '^[a-zA-Z0-9\.\,\+\-\$\_\*\!\(\)]+$'.
Some valid examples are `crm123` , `premiumtier123` , `summercampaignshoes`.

dStreamId.name: streamId
dStreamId.description: The alphanumeric identifier for this stream.

orgId.name: d_orgid
orgId.description:
Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.
It must match the Org Id provided via x-gw-ims-org-id, if present.

formOrgId.name: d_orgid
formOrgId.description:
Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.
It must match the Org Id provided via x-gw-ims-org-id, if present.

hOrgId.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
hOrgId.description: Your company's Organization ID. It must match the format: ([A-Za-z0-9]*)@AdobeOrg. See [Authenticating with Adobe IO](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/aam-customer-api/help/alpha-guide/implementation-guide/adobe-io-integration.html#obtain-api-key) for more information.

dSid.name: d_sid
dSid.description: SID stands for score ID. This is a unique ID for a trait or a segment.

formSid.name: d_sid
formSid.description: SID stands for score ID. This is a unique ID for a trait or a segment.

dTDpid.name: d_tdpid
dTDpid.description: Passes a data source for trait evaluation. Only traits from this data source are evaluated. See [Supported Attributes for DCS API Calls](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/api-and-sdk-code/dcs/dcs-api-reference/dcs-keys.html).

formTDpid.name: d_tdpid
formTDpid.description: Passes a data source for trait evaluation. Only traits from this data source are evaluated. See [Supported Attributes for DCS API Calls](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/api-and-sdk-code/dcs/dcs-api-reference/dcs-keys.html).

dUuid.name: d_uuid
dUuid.description: Unique Audience Manager user ID. See [Index of IDs in Audience Manager](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/ids-in-aam.html).

formUuid.name: d_uuid
formUuid.description: Unique Audience Manager user ID. See [Index of IDs in Audience Manager](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/ids-in-aam.html).

dMid.name: d_mid
dMid.description:
Specifies the Experience Cloud ID set and used by the Experience Cloud ID service.
See [The Experience Cloud Id Service](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/mcvid/mcvid_cookies.html) and [Index of IDs in Audience Manager](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/ids-in-aam.html).

formMid.name: d_mid
formMid.description:
Specifies the Experience Cloud ID set and used by the Experience Cloud ID service.
See [The Experience Cloud Id Service](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/mcvid/mcvid_cookies.html) and [Index of IDs in Audience Manager](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/ids-in-aam.html).

dCid.name: d_cid
dCid.description: Contains a pair of data provider ID and data provider user ID separated by `%01`. See [CID Replaces DPID and DPUUID](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/cid.html).

formCid.name: d_cid
formCid.description: Contains a pair of data provider ID and data provider user ID separated by `%01`. See [CID Replaces DPID and DPUUID](https://docs.adobe.com/help/en/audience-manager/user-guide/reference/cid.html).

dWs.name: d_ws
dWs.description:
Write Style indicator: how the provided signals and/or trait IDs act upon the given profile(s).
If not provided, the request is evaluated as an APPEND operation.
If an Overwrite operation is set, the request must also contain the `d_tdpid` parameter.

formWs.name: d_ws
formWs.description:
Write Style indicator: how the provided signals and/or trait IDs act upon the given profile(s).
If not provided, the request is evaluated as an APPEND operation.
If an Overwrite operation is set, the request must also contain the `d_tdpid` parameter.

dLocationId.name: d_location_id
dLocationId.description: One or more [location hints](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-regions.html) that correspond to the region where we've previously seen this user interacting with the Adobe services.

formLocationId.name: d_location_id
formLocationId.description: One or more [location hints](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-regions.html) that correspond to the region where we've previously seen this user interacting with the Adobe services.

dataSourceId.name: dataSourceId
dataSourceId.description: The unique identifier of the Audience Manager data source that this identity is part of.

id.name: id
id.description: The Id of the profile that belongs to the data source you provided above.

UpdateUsersDataRequest.description: Wrapper for multiple profile updates that belong to a given data stream.

tracing_id.description: Optional trace ID for tracking operations tied to a stream across our systems.

UserDataOperation.description: An Audience Manager profile update representation.

identities.description:
The identities which the profile update acts upon.
For more details, see [Profile Merge Rules](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/profile-link-intro.html).

traitEvaluation.description: The signals that should be evaluated against the provided data sources to determine which traits should be written to the profile(s).

traitInput.description: The trait IDs that should be written to the profile(s).

targetDataSource.description: The data sources the provided signals and trait IDs should be evaluated against.

operationType.description:
It dictates how the provided signals and/or trait IDs act upon the given profile(s).
By default, each profile update is an `APPEND` operation.
If an `OVERWRITE` operation is provided, then the `targetDataSource` array must not be empty and contain one single data source.

routingHint.description: The routing information used for passing on the updated profile data to the right edge region.

dataSourceId.description: The unique identifier of the Audience Manager Data Source, that this identity is part of.

integrationCode.description: The integration code of the Audience Manager Data Source, that this identity is part of.

namespaceCode.description: The corresponding UIS Namespace Code associated to the Audience Manager Data Source this identity is part of.

TraitEvaluation.description: The signals that should be evaluated against the provided data sources to determine what traits should be written to the profile.

Signal.description:
The Audience Manager smallest data units used for constructing traits.
For more details, see [Signals, Traits and Segments](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/c_signal_trait_segment.html).

TraitInput.description:
The trait IDs that should be written to the profile(s).
For more details, see [Signals, Traits and Segments](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/c_signal_trait_segment.html).

RoutingHint.description: The routing information used for passing on the updated profile(s) data to the right edge region.

profileLocationId.description:
A [location hint](https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/aam/dcs-regions.html)
that corresponds to the region where we've previously seen this user
interacting with the Adobe services.

transactionId.description: The unique identifier of the given request.

tracingId.description: The provided tracing ID for tracking operations tied to a stream across our systems.

status.description:
SUCCESS is the default - all the profile updates have been successfully processed.

PARTIAL_SUCCESS - some of the profile updates could not be successfully processed due to internal errors.

BAD_DATA - at least one profile update was malformed.

INTERNAL_ERROR - failed to process the given profile updates.

UNAUTHORIZED - the provided credentials are not applicable in the provided request.

details.message: Unable to process operation due to internal errors.

summaries.description: Profile summary broken down by region

profile.description: The expanded view of the profile

regionId.description: The region id where the profile is stored

source.description: The type of the profile source.

thirdPartyTraitsCount.description: The number of third party traits

id.description: The id value this profile corresponds to.

namespace.description: The namespace (data source) of the Audience Manager Data Source, that the provided id is part of.

links.description: The ids linked to the provided one.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Audience Manager Data Source, that an identity is part of.

integration code.description: The integration code of this data source

data provider name.description: The name of the partner/customer that created the trait

id.description: The unique identifier of the trait.

data provider name.description: The name of the partner/customer that created the trait

last realization.description: The datetime of the latest trait realization.

id.description: The unique identifier of the segment.

data provider name.description: The name of the partner/customer that created the segment

active.description: It signals whether the segments is active or not.

id.description: The value of the linked id that belongs to the below namespace.

namespace.description: The unique identifier of the Audience Manager Data Source, that this identity is part of.

linking datetime.description: The date when the ids were linked.

operationIndex.description:
The operation which could not be successfully processed.
The indexing starts from 1.
